perturbation.changed_text: During the Term of this Agreement, Premier shall be required to purchase a Minimum Annual Order Volume ("MAOV") of [***] ("Units") for the twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2018 and ending June 30, 2019. The MAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage's [***] facility and approval of that facility by Premier by January 1, 2019. For the avoidance of doubt, the six-month period commencing July 1, 2022 and ending December 31, 2022, Premier will be required to purchase [***]. perturbation.explanation: By adding 'Premier's obligation to purchase MAOV will be at their discretion for any Contract Period,' we introduce a contradiction. The original text mandates a minimum purchase, while the modified text suggests the purchase is discretionary, creating uncertainty and potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: Except as otherwise specified above in this Amendment, all other terms, conditions and covenants of the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect.
perturbation.changed_text: Except as otherwise specified above in this Amendment, all other terms, conditions and covenants of the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect. However, any clause referencing a 'Contract Period' is now subject to renegotiation at Premier's request.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause reaffirms the existing agreement. By adding the sentence 'However, any clause referencing a 'Contract Period' is now subject to renegotiation at Premier's request,' a contradiction is introduced. This allows Premier to potentially alter previously agreed-upon terms related to 'Contract Period,' creating conflict and uncertainty about enforcement of the original agreement.
